page.title: 09NEWBOLD-ON-STOUR
page.content: Newbold village has developed a lot since Norman times.There are a mixture of old and new houses.The village is concentrated along the main road between Stratford-upon-Avon and Oxford.There are a few lanes that end in farm tracks or dead ends.At the top of Moss Lane there is a pond.There is a story about a girl who was walking her dog when she got pulled into the pond by her dog and was drowned.Her ghost is supposed to haunt the area. Altogether there are 87 houses in the two Newbold squares.There are 36 terraced houses,8 farms,22 detached houses,4 shops,17 semi detached houses and 2 churches (1 Methodist,1 Church of England).There is a Church of England school.Some of the houses are owned by the County Council.There are houses of all ages,from very old to very modern.
